Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the idea that Little Red Riding Hood has been completely banned in America.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that Little Red Riding Hood has been banned in America.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that assault weapons have not been banned in America, which may not be entirely accurate.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for why Little Red Riding Hood was banned, such as the inclusion of a bottle of wine in the girl's basket.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that assault weapons have not been completely banned in America.
Falters at times: The claim may falter in its attempt to compare the banning of a book with the regulation of assault weapons.
Understate: The claim may understate the complexity of the issue surrounding the banning of books and regulation of assault weapons.
